section.title: Description
section.p: This class contains attributes and associations that are helpful in interpretation of the radiology/nuclear medicine image as known by the originating VistA system. File 2005.

stentry.p: The date and time the image was last viewed or accessed.
Contains the date and time on which the image was captured. It is not the same as the date and time of the procedure or exam.
When an image is created from an external PACS system, this property will contain the unique identifier for the image within that system.
This is a code for the type of data that is stored in the file that is described in the current record. Possible values are Text; Large X-Ray; Targa(TM); Thumbnail; DICOM; etc.
The Internal Entry Number of the Image File Entry
A categorization of the image, which can be used for searching and sorting. See VistA table 2005.82 for example values. Possible values (from VA) include: Administrative, Clinical, Admin/Clinical.
This is the natural language name of the object; usually consists of the patient name, social security number, and object description.
A categorization of the image, which can be used for searching and sorting. See VistA table 2005.83 for example values.
Identifies and enables screening of images that have duplicate instances in the archive file and the image file. Possible values are YES; etc.
Indicates that this image entry has questionable integrity. Possible values are YES etc.
This is the description of the image at length.
Description of the Microscopic Objective selected by the pathologist. It identifies the power of the microscope objective used when capturing the image of the slide.

A categorization of the image based on the organization which originated the image. For the VA, possible values include VA, Non-VA, DOD, Fee-Basis, etc. Similar concepts can be generalized for other agencies.
Contains the Anatomic Pathology accession number - the identifying number for the slide.

Categorizes the procedure that generated the image. Possible values include: Colonoscopy, Surgery, Surgical pathology, Radiology. This property can be used to help locate individual images or even classes of images for research.
The date and time the image was last viewed or accessed.
A more finely grained categorizaton (than the procedureCategory) of the procedure that generated the image. Used for sorting and searching of the images. See VistA table 2005.85 for example values.
A brief, one-line description of the image or object.

Categorizes the software system or package that generated and/or accesses the image. Used to locate appropriate images when accessed by the software package. Possible values include (from the VA): Radiology, Laboratory, Medicine, Clinical Document, Surgery, Photo ID, etc.
A categorization of the image by specialty/subspecialty, which can be used for searching and sorting. See VistA table 2005.84 for example values.
Description of the Histological Stain used in the preparation of the specimen.
Device that performed the image Acquisition. Pointer to file #2006.04.
The location at which the image was taken
The location where the professional service was performed. Pointer to file #44.
A pointer to the Network Location file giving the jukebox platter where the image is stored (provided there is a jukebox in the Imaging System).
Contains the data elements and associations related to an DICOM (Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine)-compliant image copy event. Maintains an audit trail of the copy.
Person who deletes/Nullifies this treatment record.
The patient that the image or object belongs to. Pinter to File #2.
Represents the radiology/nuclear medicine report as known by the originating VistA system. Equivalent to File 74.
Medical specialty that performed the Non OR procedure. Equivalent to a pointer to File #2005.84
